briefTitle: U/S Guided Rhomboid Intercostal Block Combined With Sub-Serratus Plane Block vs Type 2 Pectoral Nerve Block
officialTitle: Ultrasound Guided Rhomboid Intercostal Block Combined With Sub-Serratus Plane Block vs Type 2 Pectoral Nerve Block in Analgesia for Breast Cancer Surgery
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. Female patients.
2. Scheduled for unilateral conservative mastectomy.
3. Age 18-65 years.
4. American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) physical status I- II.

Exclusion Criteria:

1. Patient refusal.
2. Coagulation disorders.
3. Body mass index \> 40 kg/m2.
4. Uncooperative or psychiatric patients.
5. Infection at the injection site.
6. Patients with a history of allergy to local anesthetics.
7. Patients with a history of treatment for chronic pain.
8. Previous history of breast surgery or other chest surgery.
